reviews.review:
This is what first person shooters are all about.

Deathmatches - 64 players - Weapon Variety - Guns that shoot straight and actually kill you.

Decent Campaign. Long Winded story for the book worms at the start, you have to sit through for 20 minutes till it gets going.

Weapon Variety, a thing lacking from HL2+

If you have not played, get it - you wont be disappointed.

Довольное интересное дополнение ( не DLC ) к Half-Life. Довольно сильно затянула, интересный сюжет, со стороны солдата спецназа, хоть всё в игре и на английском, но и без него можно понять о чем идет речь. Пойдет тем кому понравилс я оригинальный Half-Life, но уже надоело однообразие, так как здесь предоставленно: новое оружие, новые враги, и много ещё интересного и познавательного.
9.5/10

De las 2 campañas alternativas del Half Life esta es la mejor sin duda! y fue la primera en presentar los hermosos nuevos modelos que tiene el HL 1 y el HL blue Shiel!

ademas te la pasas buscandote a ti mismo de un universo paralelo mientras juegas al HL 1 por todo el juego XD

DATO EXTRA!

No se fijen en los modelos Hexagonales de la fotos del juego, el juego recibio una actualizacion para cambiar los detalles del HL 1 el HL blue Shiel el Cs 1.6 el CSCZ, y los otros juegos de valve, lo que no entiendo! es por que no cambian esas FOTOS DE LA TIENDA! que son tan viejas!
A wonderful expansion to half life worth buying

Nostalgia!

This Half Life expansion takes a different spin. Instead of playing a Black Mesa personal you are Corporal Adrian Shepard and you are task to hunt down Gordon Freeman and terminate him. You think it would be easy, instead just like the Black Mesa personal you are thrown into the chaos that is wrecking havoc all across the facility and just like everyone else. You must fight your way through the facility and survive. 

This game adds a lit bit of something new to the game. Not only new alien species. But also team effort. Your AI squad mates that are dotted throughout the huge complex. Be warn however there are some instances that they MUST SURVIVE if they die then you will have to start all over again from where you last save. So keep them alive and work with them.

This game adds more puzzle and more exploration to the huge facility which is always nice. The only minor complaint is the senstivity in some cases it can get really annoying or dizzy when doing these physical puzzles (jump, crouch jump) those sort of puzzles. Unlike in the previous games where the looking senstivity and what not seems more slower. So beware of that.

If you are a Half Life fan and want a taste of of military action. Half Life style. This game is recommended
This game has more than you can expect from it!
да норм игрушка
It's possible I enjoyed this game more than the game it's based on. Adds some extra depth to the original story and a ton of awesome new wepons!

Esta no es una simple DLC de Half-Life, casi es un juego entero aparte de éste. Duración muy buena, con mil armas y enemigos nuevos que te pondrán los pelos de punta. De las manos del militar Adrian Shephard, demuéstrale quién eres a ese tal Gordon Freeman que según dicen está matando a tus compañeros. O... puede que la cosa se tuerza. Nadie está a salvo en Black Mesa.
So THIS is what happened to Shepard after ME3!

Opposing Force differs from Half-Life & Half-Life Blue Shift, as ur playing as the team that is suppose to terminate all personnels from Black Mesa, you will play as the role of a Soldier, by the name of Coporal Sheppard, again, you should play Half-Life first, then either this or Blue shift in order to understand the whole gameplay. Otherwise there will be loopholes .

Skvelé DLC s novými zbraňami,funkciami a veľmi nevídané - Vojak v Half-Life,dokonca zaň môžete hrať.

When you buy what's called an "expansion pack" from 1999 in 2014, you don't expect it to be really long. Well, you can't be more wrong.

Half-Life : Opposing Force could be a stand-alone game, by its length and difficulty. Where in Half-Life you find weapons, ammunitions and health packs in almost every room, you find yourself often with amunitions depleted and running with 10 health in Opposing Force. The game challenges you more than the original, the enemies are more unforgiving and the story feels more immersive due to the frequent interactions you have with other soldiers, where Gordon spends the major part of his quest alone in silence in Half-Life.

Do you want to play a game like Half-Life with a more interesting challenge while following a more immersive character ? Play Opposing Force.
Скучно.
Very entertaining

i like the game but at the chapter world collides i go down the elevator  cause a black mesa guard tells me that theres a creature top side so i got to go down the elevator and then i get an error and the game stops

This game is the first official expansion pack for Half-Life and it’s a pretty decent one as well. First off the storyline is set about half way through the original storyline of Half-Life and follows in parallel with it. You play as a lone marine named Corporal Adrian Shepherd and the gameplay is pretty much exactly the same as Half-Life. Basically you get to explore completely different areas of the Black Mesa Research Facility during the residents cascade and append new weapons in the game. Plus this expansion pack features new player models for multiplayer and NPCs for the single player campaign. It’s certainly good quality for an expansion pack released almost a year exactly from Half-Life’s release date. If you’ve played Half-Life then you should consider buying this as you also get a decent amount of new content as well.
GOOD ASS GAME
I actually liked it more then the original Half-Life.
Отличное дополнение к Half Life.
This game is a masterpiece of its time.
10/10 would bang.
Buy this or die
One of the greatest games ever made. best exp pack to Half-Life 10/10

Half-Life: Opposing Force is an expansion (of sorts) of the first Half-Life game. This time you take the role of Corporal Shephard, a soldier sent on a government cleanup mission at Black Mesa. This is an interesting viewpoint on the events of Black Mesa, and everything is tied in nicely to the events of the original game. For example, the player at one point is in the same room as the military announcer saying "Forget about Freeman!", and you even get to see Half-Life's main hero, Gordon Freeman, just before he goes to Xen. 
Although not developed by Valve, Gearbox did a decent job in the creation of this game. It's around 7 hours long and introduces several new weapons, enemies, features, and followers. One of these new weapons is a detached Barnacle, which is used as a sort of grappling hook. There are a bunch of new, unique, and difficult aliens and black-ops personnel (who are cleaning up the initial military cleanup, a little redundant) that the player goes up against. New features include rope climbing and night vision instead of the typical flashlight, as well as fellow servicemen followers with unique abilities (such as a medic, engineer, or just a firearms man).
One issue with this game is that it seems unbalanced. At one point there's a short segment of dark, creepy tunnels full of large creatures which is followed by an annoyingly long combat segment. It's not like this the whole time, but some parts are too long and others are too short.
Opposing Force also contains many glitches. Here's a few that I encountered:
[*]During battles, allies will walk into your line of fire as you're shooting, and then they will turn and shoot you.
[*]After battles, allies would still be firing/throwing grenades, sometimes hurting the player.
[*]Following allies randomly stop, requiring the player to go back and retrieve them.
[*]In a few loading screens and/or elevators, the player will get stuck in the floor, unable to move.
[*]Sudden, unreasonable deaths; I assume this is a fall damage glitch.

However, I don't mean to knock the game. As long as you don't mind dated visuals and occasional frustrations, this is a quality shooter, especially if you enjoy the Half-Life series as much as I do! For the price, this is definitely worth a shot.
Solid expansion pack, do recomend.

Half Life oyunun ilk genişleme paketi. Half Life oyununda sizi ve tüm Black Mesa ekibini öldürmek ile görevli asker Adrian Shephard'i yönetiyoruz bu eklenti paketinde. Mekanlar genel olarak ilk oyuna benzer ama yeni mekanlarda yok değil. Silah çeşitliliği yine çok iyi. Oyuna farklı bir kişinin gözünden bakmak bana çok hoş geldi. Çok beğendim. Oyun hakkında yeni bir çok bilgi öğreniyorsunuz. Müzikler yine 10 numara. Oyunda Gordon Freeman'ı tekrar görmek de çok hoşuma gitti. Sanki ilk oyunu tekrar oynuyor gibi hissettim kendimi. Bir eklenti paketi için gerçekten çok iyi. 

★ SONUÇ ★

Half Life'ı oynamış birisinin bu eklenti paketini mutlaka oynaması gerektiğini düşünüyorum.

Highly Recommended for any half life fan. Although the graphics and animations are outdated, it is hard to find many shooters that compare to this one in gameplay. You will never be doing the same thing and you will never be passively clearing out levels. If you are a shooter fan, its five bucks...just download it and have fun.

Half Life Opposing Force sets a new bench mark for expansion packs even to this day and is a great continuation of the Half Life story and gameplay. Telling storys and game events from differant prespectives, ephisese on other asspects of gameplay and overall improved charecter models are all what make this a must buy expansion. Best of all, its a standalone game but you'd be hard presed not to get this expansion without buying the original Half Life. Everything that made the original Half Life Great is here.

Muy buena expansión de Half-Life donde nos pondremos en la piel del cabo Shepard, miembro de la Marina, el cual su misión es acabar con todos los científicos de Black Mesa y sobretodo con Gordon Freeman, para ocultar el accidente ocurrido.

Es una expansión que trae creo que todas las armas del original y encima añade de nuevas MUY interesantes, además de más enemigos y sobretodo MUCHA más dificultad.

Shepard se controla igual que Freeman, él también dispone del medidor de salud y escudo en su traje, pero lo que diferencia a Shepard de Freeman es que este (a parte de notar que corre mucho más rápido) cuenta con visión nocturna, cosa que hará mucho más únicas algunas partes del juego.

Expansión que todo y no ser muy relevante para la historia de Half-Life, recomiendo muchísimo y goza de una duración respetable. Perfecta por si te quedastes con ganas de más Half-Life y quieres jugar una versión desde otro punto de vista mucho más "hardcore".

История развивается по спирали. Была когда-то такая маленькая команда, Rebel Boat Rockers, и делала она игрушечку Prax Wars, которую должна была издавать Electronic Arts. Но чем-то этот спецназовский 3D-action не приглянулся господам издателям, и кислород RBR’ам перекрыли. А надо сказать, что ребятки в студии были далеко не с улицы. Многие из них делали сначала Duke Nukem 3D, а потом и Sin. И поэтому не повесили хлопцы свои головушки, не закручинились, а мигом переназвались в Gearbox Software и подрядились делать аддон для Half-Life (по мнению кучи авторитетных источников, в том числе и нас, лучшей игры 1998 года). И чтобы далеко не отходить от своей линии, которую RBR’ы гнули в Prax Wars, они назвали аддон Opposing Force и сделали главного героя самым настоящим спецназовцем. Так что сбылась мечта... Мы имеем отличный аддон от небольшой команды. Хотя он и вышел спустя год после оригинальной игры, прошедшее время не давит на него тяжелым грузом. Смена врага часто позволяет влить свежую кровь в нашу жизнь. А если врагом становится бывшее альтер эго в лице Фримена... В общем, если вы в свое время протащились от Half-Life, то Opposing Force — штучка явно для вас. Играть, черт возьми, интересно, не менее интересно, чем просто в Half-Life. А это — самое главное для аддона, не так ли?

The first of two expansion packs for Half Life. Half Life Opposing Force takes you on the role of Corporal Adrian Shepard where your helicopter crashes just before you've been given orders and now you run like hell trying to escape the Black Mesa facility. I gotta admit this is a pretty intriguing setup as you now have a new perspective of the Half Life universe. 

The story is quite good as a whole and the pacing is nice. The tutorial, now that's probably the best tutorial I've ever played. Training in a military academy and being barked at by my commander, it really sets the mood. Graphics I won't go too much into detail but I used the HD texture pack that was included with Blue Shift and I don't mind either personally so it's entirely subjective whether you prefer the old or new textures.

Music is minimal but very good, a little obscure but I like that. It makes it unique in a good way. In terms of gameplay it's Half Life with some new enemies and weapons just as an expansion should work. The new aliens are cool, a couple you get to use certain organ parts as weapons which is pretty sweet. You even get to have a Barnacle Gun which is used pretty well for some puzzles. The Black Ops soldiers later on get pretty annoying and they're placed in some pretty cheap spots you'd never react to in time on your first try.

This time not only do you get help from the Black Mesa staff but also your HECU brothers. You'll need to stick with them in order for them to help you since Black Ops soldiers have been ordered to target any grunt marines in the facility. As for their A.I. They're okay but a bit static but they do the job in healing and opening doors for you.

I ran into a couple of glitches like in the original Half Life but they didn't do too much to hinder the game. 

Should you get this standalone expansion? Hell yeah it's only $5 and you could spend much worse these days. The cool story along with the good pacing, puzzles (oh yeah the puzzles are better now) and awesome aliens to shoot makes this a well made package. This gets a 8/10

Action-packed expansion, cool new weapons and enemy types, took me 6 hours to complete vs. the 13 hours it took me to complete Half-Life, annoyingly though on OS X there's a bug where after defeating the final boss the ending cutscene doesn't load. Tried loading mid-boss battle save and killing boss again but it didn't work, had to watch it on YouTube instead :/ There were also at least 5 occasions where my character got stuck and couldn't move leading me to have to load an earlier save. If you've got the choice between Windows and OS X go for the former, I've noticed in Blue Shift there's s few animation glitches as well (not unplayable, though).

I snagged this in a big Half-Life bundle on the cheap. This game is really dated, but as someone who loves Half-Life and just finished Half-Life: Source, this was a lot of fun to play. Better than Half-Life 2: Episode Two—IMO.
